source.title: Evaluate Need for Purification as per Formulation

source.description:
To determine the formulation of the vendor antibody solution refer to the vendor data sheet for product specifications.
Refer to Table 7.1, for additives that require the antibody to be purified.
ABCD
1FormulationAdditiveBufferNeeds purification
2Tissue culture supernatantN/APBSYes
3Ascites FluidN/APBSYes
4PurifiedStabilizer e.g. BSAPBSYes
5PurifiedContains both BSA and GlycerolPBSDilute glycerol content to 10% (5% preferred) before purification
6PurifiedStabilizer e.g. TrehalosePBSNo
7PurifiedStabilizer e.g. GelatinPBSYes
8PurifiedAny amine e.g. glycine etc.PBSIf amine is low molecular weight -Buffer exchange using Amicon filters
9PurifiedN/ATRISBuffer exchange using Amicon filters
10PurifiedGlycerolPBSBuffer exchange using Amicon filters
11PurifiedAzide (up to 0.1%)PBSNo
12PurifiedN/APBSIf concentration below 0.5 mg/mL, concentrate using Amicon filters

ABCD
1FormulationAdditiveBufferNeeds purification
2Tissue culture supernatantN/APBSYes
3Ascites FluidN/APBSYes
4PurifiedStabilizer e.g. BSAPBSYes
5PurifiedContains both BSA and GlycerolPBSDilute glycerol content to 10% (5% preferred) before purification
6PurifiedStabilizer e.g. TrehalosePBSNo
7PurifiedStabilizer e.g. GelatinPBSYes
8PurifiedAny amine e.g. glycine etc.PBSIf amine is low molecular weight -Buffer exchange using Amicon filters
9PurifiedN/ATRISBuffer exchange using Amicon filters
10PurifiedGlycerolPBSBuffer exchange using Amicon filters
11PurifiedAzide (up to 0.1%)PBSNo
12PurifiedN/APBSIf concentration below 0.5 mg/mL, concentrate using Amicon filters

source.title: Column Equilibration

source.description:
Remove the Protein A or Protein G column from
and allow it to equilibrate to room temperature (~1/2hr).

source.body: Protein A is used to purify rabbit antibodies. Protein G is used to purify all mouse IgG. For purification of antibodies from other species, please consult the product insert.

source.title: Column Equilibration

source.description: Screw on the red luer lock adapter in to the top of the column and break off the bottom tab.

source.title: Column Equilibration

source.description:
Wash the column with
at a flow of 1-2 drops/second.
Using a syringe, draw
.
  • Attach syringe to the top of the column.
  • Gently push down on the syringe to deliver at flow rate of 1-2 drops/second.
  • Collect flow through in a waste beaker.
o Discard any flow through liquid

source.title: dH2O
dH2O
Column Equilibration

source.description:
In order to equilibrate the column, wash with
at a flow of 1-2 drops/second.
Using a syringe draw up
.
  • Attach syringe to the top of the column.
  • Gently push down on the syringe to deliver 1-2 drops/second flow rate.
  • Collect flow through in a waste beaker.
o Discard any flow through liquid

source.title: 1X Binding Buffer
1X Binding Buffer
Antibody Application to the HiTrap Column

source.description:
Remove the unpurified antibody from the
.

source.title: Antibody Application to the HiTrap Column

source.description:
Retain
for troubleshooting purposes.

source.title: unpurified antibody
Antibody Application to the HiTrap Column

source.description:
Use a 5mL syringe to remove the remaining volume of un-purified antibody from the antibody vial.
  • Use a small gauge needle (23g, usually) to reach the bottom of the container if needed.
  • Retain antibody solution in the syringe.

source.title: Antibody Application to the HiTrap Column

source.description:
To remove the residual antibody, rinse the antibody vial with
.
  • This step is only done if you are not returning the retained 5µg of unpurified antibody (step 7) to the original vial.
  • If you are returning the retained 5µg of unpurified antibody (step 7) to the original vial, use a separate Eppendorf vial to draw up the 1X binding buffer from - so as to not contaminate the stock vial.

source.title: 1X Binding Buffer
Antibody Application to the HiTrap Column

source.description: Using the same 5 mL syringe, remove the wash volume from the antibody vial.

source.title: Antibody Application to the HiTrap Column

source.description: Remove the needle, invert the syringe and remove any air bubbles by gently flicking the sides of the syringe.

source.title: Antibody Application to the HiTrap Column

source.description:
Apply the antibody sample to the column at a rate of 1-2 drop/second, collecting flow through liquid in a 15 mL conical tube.
  • Minimize the amount of air pushed through the column
  • Save the flow through for potential troubleshooting.
  • Discard after 24 hours - typically discarded after adequate recovery of the antibody is shown.

source.title: Wash Unbound proteins from the HiTrap column

source.description: Prepare five 1.5 mL clear eppendorf tubes by labeling them W1-W5 (Wash 1-Wash 5).

source.title: Wash Unbound proteins from the HiTrap column

source.description:
Measure
in a new 5 mL syringe.

source.title: fresh 1X Binding Buffer
Wash Unbound proteins from the HiTrap column

source.description: Apply the 1X Binding Buffer to the column at a flow rate of 1-2 drop/second.

source.title: Wash Unbound proteins from the HiTrap column

source.description:
Collect
in the labeled tubes starting with W1 and proceed in sequential order.

source.title: fractions of the wash
Wash Unbound proteins from the HiTrap column

source.description:
Vortex each wash for
. Briefly centrifuge to remove any liquid from the underside of the cap and upper parts of the tube.

source.title: Use the NanoDrop to confirm the complete removal of unbound protein

source.description: Open the Nanodrop program from the computer connected to the Nanodrop.

source.title: Use the NanoDrop to confirm the complete removal of unbound protein

source.description: From the main screen select “Proteins A280” program.

source.title: Use the NanoDrop to confirm the complete removal of unbound protein

source.description: Within the “Protein A280” program, select Type BSA, refer to Figure 7.5.1

source.title: Use the NanoDrop to confirm the complete removal of unbound protein

source.description:
To blank the system, add
to the pedestal.

source.description: Select “Blank.”

source.title: Use the NanoDrop to confirm the complete removal of unbound protein

source.description: After blanking is completed, wipe pedestal with a Kimwipe or other low lint wipe.

source.title: Use the NanoDrop to confirm the complete removal of unbound protein

source.description:
To ensure a stable baseline add
to the pedestal.

source.title: fresh 1X Binding Buffer
Use the NanoDrop to confirm the complete removal of unbound protein

source.description:
Select “Measure”
  • Refer to Figure 7.5.2
  • A stable baseline (right) shows a level line at zero with little signal noise.
  • An unstable unacceptable baseline appears tilted.

source.title: Use the NanoDrop to confirm the complete removal of unbound protein

source.description: After measuring, wipe pedestal with a Kimwipe.

source.title: Use the NanoDrop to confirm the complete removal of unbound protein

source.description: Once a stable baseline is achieved measure the absorbance of each wash step in triplicate

source.title: Use the NanoDrop to confirm the complete removal of unbound protein

source.description: After each measurement, wipe pedestal with a kimwipe.

source.title: Use the NanoDrop to confirm the complete removal of unbound protein

source.description:
The Nanodrop will calculate the protein concentration of each reading.
If a protein concentration at >0.03 mg/mL is present in Wash 5, continue collecting
until the concentration in the last wash reads <0.03 mg/mL (as was done in step 16) or until the concentration reading remains constant (this may be a sign your antibody is leaching off).

source.description: Remove Amicon 30K filter from its packaging.

source.description: Fill the filter to the top with dH2O and cap.

source.title: Preparing Amicon 30K filtration device

source.description: Gently invert the filter 5 times.

source.title: Preparing Amicon 30K filtration device

in the centrifuge.

After
discard the flow through liquid.

source.title: Preparing Amicon 30K filtration device

source.description: Repeat steps 31-34 one more time.

source.description: Prepare five 1.5 mL eppendorf tubes by labeling them E1-E5 (Elution1-Elution5).

source.description:
Measure
and pipette into tubes E2-E5.

into a 5 mL syringe.

to the HiTrap Column at a flow rate of 1-2 drops/second.

Collect

Eluting the purified antibody from the HiTrap Column

source.description:
Vortex each fraction for
.
  • Alternately, invert tube and flick so as to mix.
  • Centrifuge briefly so as to remove solution from the underside of the cap and the upper parts of the tube.

source.title: Confirming the complete removal of purified antibody via NanoDrop

source.description: From the opened Nanodrop program, select “Proteins A280” program.

source.title: Confirming the complete removal of purified antibody via NanoDrop

source.description: Within the “Protein A280” program, select protein Type: IgG. Refer to Figure 7.8.1.

source.title: Confirming the complete removal of purified antibody via NanoDrop

source.description:
To blank the system add
to the pedestal.

source.title: Neutralized Elution Buffer
Confirming the complete removal of purified antibody via NanoDrop

source.description: Select “Blank.”

source.title: Confirming the complete removal of purified antibody via NanoDrop

source.description: After blanking has completed, wipe pedestal with a Kimwipe.

source.title: Confirming the complete removal of purified antibody via NanoDrop

source.description:
To ensure a stable baseline add
to the pedestal.

source.title: Neutralized Elution Buffer
Confirming the complete removal of purified antibody via NanoDrop

source.description:
Select “Measure”
  • After measuring, wipe pedestal with a Kimwipe. If a satisfactory baseline isn't achieved, return to step 41.
  • Refer to Figure 7.5.2.

source.title: Confirming the complete removal of purified antibody via NanoDrop

source.description: In subsequent steps, recover the antibody after each measurement by drawing it back in to the pipette and placing it back into the assigned eppendorf tube.

source.title: Confirming the complete removal of purified antibody via NanoDrop

source.description:
Measure each fraction in triplicate, generally the first fraction will be free of any protein, elution 2 and 3 will contain pure antibody, and elution 4 and 5 will be free of any protein.
    If fraction 5 contains a protein concentration > 0.03 mg/mL continue collecting
    until no more protein is eluted.

source.title: fractions
Concentration and Buffer Exchange of the purified antibody

source.description: Combine all elution fractions with a protein concentration of >0.03 mg/mL into the prepared Amicon 30K filter.

source.title: Concentration and Buffer Exchange of the purified antibody

source.description: Fill the filter to the manufacturer's recommended level with fresh 1X PBS.

source.title: Concentration and Buffer Exchange of the purified antibody

source.description: Apply the cap and invert the filter 5 times to completely mix the PBS and antibody solution.

source.title: Concentration and Buffer Exchange of the purified antibody

source.description:
Place the solution in the centrifuge and spin at
.

source.title: Concentration and Buffer Exchange of the purified antibody

source.description:
After
, check the filter to ensure the volume will lead to a calculated concentration of
or higher.
Example: If you purify
, the maximum volume to spin down to would be
to get a concentration of
.
If it has not, continue spinning at
for
intervals until the appropriate volume is achieved.

source.title: Concentration and Buffer Exchange of the purified antibody

source.description:
When the solution is at or above a calculated concentration of
, remove the bottom tube and transfer the flow through liquid to a separately labeled 15 mL conical tube.

source.title: Concentration and Buffer Exchange of the purified antibody

source.description: Repeat steps 52-55, three more times for a total of 4 spins.

source.title: Concentration and Buffer Exchange of the purified antibody

source.description: Following the 4th spin, remove the filter from the 15 mL tube.

source.title: Concentration and Buffer Exchange of the purified antibody

source.description: Remove the purified antibody from the filter with a 200uL pipette.

source.title: Concentration and Buffer Exchange of the purified antibody

source.description: Transfer to a clean 1.5 mL eppendorf tube labeled with antibody name.

source.title: Concentration and Buffer Exchange of the purified antibody

source.description:
Wash the filter with
and then repeatedly pipette to wash each side of the filter.

source.title: fresh 1X PBS
Concentration and Buffer Exchange of the purified antibody

source.description: Remove the wash and combine with purified antibody in 1.5 mL Eppendorf tube from step 60.

source.title: Concentration and Buffer Exchange of the purified antibody

source.description: Close the lid of the Eppendorf tube and mix the solution gently but well, centrifuging briefly to remove liquid from the under-side of the cap.

source.title: Determining final yield via NanoDrop

source.description: From the opened Nanodrop program, select “Proteins A280” program.

source.title: Determining final yield via NanoDrop

source.description: Within the “Protein A280” program, select protein Type: IgG, Selecting protein Type: IgG.

source.title: Determining final yield via NanoDrop

source.description:
To blank the system, add
to the pedestal.

source.title: fresh 1X PBS
Determining final yield via NanoDrop

source.description: Select “Blank.”

source.title: Determining final yield via NanoDrop

source.description: After blanking, wipe pedestal with a kimwipe.

source.title: Determining final yield via NanoDrop

source.description:
Select “Measure.”
  • After measuring, wipe pedestal with a kimwipe.
  • If the baseline is poor, return to step 66.
  • Refer to Figure 7.5.2.

source.title: Determining final yield via NanoDrop

source.description: Measure the purified antibody 5 times.

source.title: Determining final yield via NanoDrop

source.description: Take a volumetric reading of the final purified antibody with a pipette and record volume.

source.title: Determining final yield via NanoDrop

source.description: Calculate %Yield ((Ab concentration (µg/µL)*Volume (µL))/Initial Ab amount (µg)). If the initial antibody amount is not known, the %yield cannot be calculated.

source.title: Determining final yield via NanoDrop

source.description: Dilute purified antibody with 0.65% Sodium Azide (Volume of purified antibody/12) to a final concentration of 0.05% Sodium Azide.

source.title: Determining final yield via NanoDrop

source.description: Label the vial of purified antibody with the biomarker name, vendor name, catalog number, lot number, date purified and final concentration.

source.title: Stabilizing the HiTrap Column with Column Storage Solution

source.body: The HiTrap columns can be re-used for up to 1 year; however, only antibodies from the same vendor and with the same clone can be re-applied to a previously used column.

source.title: Stabilizing the HiTrap Column with Column Storage Solution

source.description:
Measure
, typically 20% ethanol in water, with a 5mL syringe.

source.title: Column Storage solution
Stabilizing the HiTrap Column with Column Storage Solution

source.description: Apply solution to HiTrap column at a rate of 1-2 drops/second and discard flow through liquid.

source.title: Stabilizing the HiTrap Column with Column Storage Solution

source.description: Label the column using a tough tag labeled with the antibody name, clone, vendor, catalog number, protein type (A or G), and date opened.

source.title: Stabilizing the HiTrap Column with Column Storage Solution

source.description:
Re-attach the top and bottom enclosures and store at
for up to 1 year.

source.title: Troubleshooting

source.description: If antibody yield is <10% please check whether correct column is used for purification if yes contact vendor for support.

source.title: Troubleshooting

source.description: Also, when there is question about stabilizer such as BSA present in the antibody supplied from vendor. Please record UV spectrum of the antibody and make sure it looks like below with A260/A280=~0.70. If BSA is present A280 will go up and the ratio will drop down from 0.70 to any number depending on the amount of BSA present in the sample.

source.title: Stabilizing the HiTrap Column with Column Storage Solution

source.description:
Measure
with a 5mL syringe.

source.title: water
Stabilizing the HiTrap Column with Column Storage Solution

source.description: Apply water to HiTrap column at a rate of 1-2 drops/second and discard flow through liquid.

description: The purpose of the protocol is to purify antibodies that will be conjugated to Cy dyes as per the Cell DIVE™ technology. Affinity chromatography will be used to remove impurities from the vendor antibody to enable conjugation.
